Hmmm.... let's see for the same mana cost in red i can get..  
  
 [Keldon Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keldon Champion)  
[Blistering Firecat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blistering Firecat)  
  
[Raging Minotaur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Minotaur) if you *really* want to keep the *Minotaur* subtype. Only reason [Minotaur Tactician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Minotaur Tactician) isn't strictly worse than [Raging Minotaur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Minotaur) is because he is potentially more splash-able.  
  
Nothing to see here...

posts.post_content:
Compared to all the newer cards ( Wild Nacatl and the Cohorts from Shadowmoor ) this is a very weak card. Even older cards ( Raging Minotaur or Talruum Minotaur ) are better than this. This was a poorly designed card.  
  
Goblin Chariot is a 2/2 Haste for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) and Talruum Minotaur is a 3/3 Haste for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). that manes the difference from a 2/2 Haste and a 3/3 Haste is ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) for an X/X 'French Vanilla' Haster. A 1/1 'French Vanilla' Haster is ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). So the transition from a 1/1 to a 2/2 is ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) which can also be translated as ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol). So a 1/1 Haster with the potential to be a 3/3 should really be around ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) or ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol); learning more towards the ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) cost.  
  
At it's current cost this card is WAY to expensive.  
  
0.5/5  
  
~Zuty
posts.html:
Compared to all the newer cards ( Wild Nacatl and the Cohorts from Shadowmoor ) this is a very weak card. Even older cards ( Raging Minotaur or Talruum Minotaur ) are better than this. This was a poorly designed card.

Goblin Chariot is a 2/2 Haste for and Talruum Minotaur is a 3/3 Haste for . that manes the difference from a 2/2 Haste and a 3/3 Haste is for an X/X 'French Vanilla' Haster. A 1/1 'French Vanilla' Haster is . So the transition from a 1/1 to a 2/2 is which can also be translated as . So a 1/1 Haster with the potential to be a 3/3 should really be around or ; learning more towards the cost.

At it's current cost this card is WAY to expensive.

0.5/5

posts.post_content: Come on, Wizards, the same converted mana cost and from the same set as [Lightning Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Angel)? It's strictly worse than many different cards, including the colorless [Pierce Strider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pierce Strider) from the next set.. The good thing is that hybrid-mana costs allow you to play this card in a mono-red deck, however you would need one red/blue and one red/white creature! :(
